question.text: To an aqueous solution containing ions such as <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>Al</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>Zn</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>Ca</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>Fe</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>Ni</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><msup><mi>Ba</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>Cu</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> was added <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>conc</mi><mo>.</mo><mo> </mo><mi>HCl</mi></math>, followed by <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math>. The total number of cations precipitated during this reaction is/are :

solution.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>Al</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>Fe</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> sulphides hydrolyse in water. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>Ni</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>Zn</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> require basic medium with <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> to form precipitate.  <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>Ca</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>Ba</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> sulphides are also soluble.  only <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mi>Cu</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> can form the precipitate with <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></math> in the acidic medium.

data.bucket: Must Do Ques (JEE Main) - Any Difficulty
